intro: Malephora luteola, commonly known as the yellow malephora, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its yellow-orange flowers and palmate leaves with five to seven lobes. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
